ualberta.g12.adventurecreator.test

Class AdventureApplicationTest

  • java.lang.Object
    • junit.framework.Assert
      • junit.framework.TestCase
        • android.test.AndroidTestCase
          • ualberta.g12.adventurecreator.test.AdventureApplicationTest
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    junit.framework.Test

    public class AdventureApplicationTest
extends android.test.AndroidTestCase
    Tests the AdventureCreator the custom application object we wrote for the application The application is used to as a static singleton throughout in which it can return other singletons (mostly controllers and helpers) Adventure Application contains: StoryController,FragmentController,StoryList,StoryListController,OfflineIOHelper,OnlineHelper

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      AdventureApplicationTest() 

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void testFragmentController()
      Tests to see that the FragmentController singleton is initiated correctly, and a new FragmentController is not created every time we call the get function
      void testOfflineHelper()
      Tests to see that the FragmentController singleton is initiated correctly, and a new FragmentController is not created every time we call the get function
      void testOnlineHelper()
      Tests to see that the FragmentController singleton is initiated correctly, and a new FragmentController is not created every time we call the get function
      void testSingletonsNotNull()
      We used this test to ensure that all our singleTons are not null, as they are supposed to be created if they do not exist on the first get[Singleton] method call [Singleton] can be: StoryController,FragmentController, StoryList,StoryListController,OfflineIOHelper,OnlineHelper
      void testStoryController()
      Tests to see that the StoryController singleton is initiated correctly, and a new StoryController is not created every time we call the get function
      void testStoryList()

      • testSingletonsNotNull

        public void testSingletonsNotNull()
        We used this test to ensure that all our singleTons are not null, as they are supposed to be created if they do not exist on the first get[Singleton] method call [Singleton] can be: StoryController,FragmentController, StoryList,StoryListController,OfflineIOHelper,OnlineHelper
